results.byline: By Carl Hulse and Catie Edmondson
results.title: House G.O.P. Prepares to Slash Federal Programs in Coming Budget Showdown
results.abstract: With Social Security and Medicare off the table, conservatives are focusing on a wide range of smaller programs as a clash with President Biden and Democrats looms.

media.caption: The most conservative lawmakers in Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s Republican conference are pursuing cuts that they concede could cause political pain and blowback among their colleagues.

results.title: Preterm Birth Drug Withdrawn After 12 Years
results.abstract: The F.D.A. seemed poised to rescind approval of Makena, after studies over time indicated the treatment did not halt early childbirth for many women.

media.caption: The F.D.A. had been weighing the latest studies, which did not prove a benefit for pregnant women facing preterm birth.

results.title: D.C. Police Officer Who Shot Man in Car Is Charged With Murder

results.title: Ukraine Claims Bakhmut Battle Is Wagner’s ‘Last Stand’
results.abstract: Ukrainians say Russia’s Wagner mercenary group is running low on fighters recruited from prisons, used in attacks on Bakhmut, where Ukraine has also endured heavy losses.

results.title: This Stomach Bug Isn’t Responding to Antibiotics. Scientists Are Worried.
results.abstract: Five percent of Shigella infections are now resistant to standard antibiotics. This could be a predictor of what’s to come with other bacteria.

results.title: Long Covid Patients More Likely to Have Gastrointestinal Problems, Study Finds
results.abstract: The study, which examined patients infected early in the pandemic, found they were significantly more likely than people who didn’t get Covid to experience lingering reflux, constipation and other issues.

media.caption: A long Covid patient received a checkup last year. A study of more than 154,000 Covid patients found that they were 36 percent more likely to have gastrointestinal problems a year later than people who didn’t get Covid.

results.title: With a Marijuana Shop on ‘Every Corner,’ Oklahoma Rejects Full Legalization

results.title: Judge Throws Out Missouri Statute Restricting Federal Gun Laws
results.abstract: A federal judge ruled that the measure violated the U.S. government’s right to enforce its laws and was a threat to public safety.

media.caption: In 2021, Missouri lawmakers passed the Second Amendment Preservation Act, which prohibits state and local cooperation with federal officials on gun laws if those laws are deemed in conflict with the Second Amendment.
media.copyright: Christopher (KS) Smith for The New York Times

results.title: When Trump Passes the MAGA Hat, His Aides Clutch Their Wallets
results.abstract: Unlike other recent presidents, Donald Trump has rarely received campaign donations from his top advisers. They offer a range of explanations.

media.caption: Some of former President Donald J. Trump’s advisers said their time working for him was worth more than any check they could afford to write. Others pointed to his personal wealth and his already brimming campaign coffers.
